newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia palm ends up slightly on cautious trade.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia palm ends up slightly on cautious trade.

text.p: Malaysian palm oil prices ended the week marginally higher after being stuck in a tight range owing to a lack of market-moving news, traders said.
Trade in the week ahead promises little change, save for the May 1-25 export figures by SGS Malaysia which could affect prices on Monday, said dealers.
"The market is waiting for news to move," said one dealer.
"If it breaks the 1,220-level, then it'll set a new course," added the dealer.
At the close, the August futures contract closed four ringgit up at 1,216 ringgit ($486.21) a tonne.
